article.title: Army Funds Additional $5.6 Million for TCS SNAP Deployable Satellite Solutions
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: TeleCommunication Systems Incorporated (TCS) has received an additional $5.6 million of funding from the U.S. Army to provide additional Secure Internet Protocol Router (SIPR) and Non-secure Internet Protocol Router (NIPR) Access Point (SNAP) Very Small Aperture Terminal (VSAT) Satellite Systems as well as an assortment of data packages, forward deployed spares and field service engineers. These systems will support ongoing operations in both Iraq and Afghanistan.
